content.description:
SENIOR PROJECT 5.5 *** 105’ F/M (7b)

Climbs directly up from the belay anchor on the lower ledge to pull through the first small roof on good holds and then traverse left under the upper overhang to share the top chain anchors with “Senior Moment”. There are several horizontal gear placements possible with a wide range of cams (#0 to 3) between the widely spaced bolts.The rock is mostly excellent on this fun (if bold feeling for the grade) route with an interesting and exposed crux near the top. Possible to lower with 60m rope.
content.protection: fixed - 7 bolts, chains at the top. There are several horizontal gear placements possible with a wide range of cams (#0 to 3) between the widely spaced bolts. Possible to lower with 60m rope.
content.location: At the left end of the Upper SE Face - shares the bottom and top anchors with "Senior Moment"

content.description:
SENIOR MOMENT 5.4 * (PG) 105’ F (9b)

From the single bolt belay anchor on the lower ledge traverse left about 10’ and climb the left face of the small dihedral (crux) to follow the indistinct arete up the middle of the face to step left under and around the broken upper overhanging band and on to the pair of chains about 15' below the top.

This would be a 3 star route if not for the fractured bottom and top sections, and like some of the other easier routes at Burge may seem hard for the grade – more like an old school 5.4, and so more like a 5.6 by modern sport route standards – with many moves a body length above the last bolt.

Possible to lower with a 60 m rope.
content.protection:
fixed - 9 bolts, 2 chains below the top.

Possible to lower with a 60m rope
content.location: AT the far left end of the Upper SE Face

content.description:
POLO 5.5 ** 90' F(8b)

Begin at the base of the large corner crack at the far right end of the mid-ledge at the single bolt belay anchor (10' right of Marco) and climb the lower face until its possible to step right onto the arête. Continue to the chain anchors at the top.
content.location: Begin at the right end of the mid-ledge (single bolt belay)

content.description:
MARCO 5.6 * 95' M(8b)

Begin about 10' from the right end of the mid-ledge at the black stained face. Climb the water-marked face on incut edges to the upper overhang (following the black painted hangers). Step over this (a #1, 2 or 3 cam is needed under the lip), jog left through a bush and climb up past a section of hollow flakes to the serviceberry bush above, veer right and join Polo for the top bolt and chain anchors.
content.protection: Mixed, 8 bolts and 1 #1,2 or 3 cam is needed.
content.location: Begin at the black water stained streaks at the right end of the mid ledge.

content.description:
THE JOURNEY EAST 5.7 * 70' F(6b)

From the large ledge on the upper right side of the face (at the large pine tree), climb up and diagonally left to share the same anchors with Marco & Polo.
content.location: On the upper right ledge begin beside the large pine and climb up to the left.

content.description:
CHAPEL PERILOUS 5.8 ** 100' F (10b)

Begin at the single belay anchor about 10' left of "Marco" and climb directly up to the overhanging section with some hollow flakes, step right past the first lip then left through the second one (this bolt protected crux is safe but may be harder for a shorter climber). Continue directly up to the 2 chain anchors at the top.
content.location: In the middle of the upper SE face, begin about 10' left of the black streaks at the start of "Marco" (single bolt belay), and climb up right of the main upper overhangs.
